title: Does Article Forge generate good SEO-based content? - Quora

response.answer_text: Being in the Digital Marketing niche, needs you to be updated with all the new tools and tricks in the market. I have tried several article spinner, rewriter, and article generator tools in the past to check what is in them that makes people to buy their subscription. Honestly, I didn’t find any of them better! But as new tools come out or some old ones become popular, I give them a shot. So I tried Article Forge recently to write a 500 words article. I had to put a Heading and some sub-headings to generate the article.  And here is what I got: 486 words long article got generated in less than 2 minutes.The article wasn’t as bad as I had expected. It was readable though extra vocabulary and sentences were used.They claim to write 100% unique content so I checked it in the plagiarism tool. It was 100% unique! On analyzing, I found that it writes longer sentences and changes active into passive or passive into active sentences to make them 100% unique.Here’s my suggestion: Use It If you have some product page or a topic that you are just trying to push for SEO, you can generate an article from article forge on each of those products and then customize the article by adding your own sentences. This way, you’ll be able to write some content for the products, you were lacking ideas on. Don’t Use It If you want to do better SEO and are just trying to replace your existing content writer! People like you and I can not relate to an article created by such tools. When a human writes for another human, people relate and then engage with the content. But engagement will go down and the bounce rate will increase a lot if you are just using article forge to create content. If you have any questions or need any help, feel free to comment below :)

Tools like Article Forge can never replace the writing skills of a decent article creator no matter how intelligent the AI of the software algorithm is. Since Article Forge is supposed to be an automatic article writer then quality and uniqueness is something that this tool needs to take seriously. I have personally used Article Forge to create content for various topics and I would say the articles produced are on par with a novice article creator. I have witnessed that some topics produced much better quality articles than others. If you want some high quality science or technology article that goes into real depth then I would avoid this tool and get yourself a decent content writer. But if you want a generic article on a particular topic related to your niche, which helps to provide your visitors to topical and relevant content. Then Article Forge can produce interesting articles and is a much cheaper and time saving option to either writing articles yourself or outsourcing out to a content writer. Most automated or rewriting tools on the market tend to create articles that look robotic when reading them. They tend to choose the wrong synonyms to go in the sentences and therefore look like someone with low literacy wrote the article. It simply does not make sense and is completely out of context on most occasions. Article Forge however does do a good job of producing articles that actually make some sense when you read them back. And the articles that made sense were of a good enough quality that your visitors would read and find them interesting. But don’t expect a three thousand word pillar article using Article Forge. The best articles created by the tool are between 500 and 600 words long. You will need to do some decent keyword research since this how Article Forge determines the topic to automatically create the article on. You need to enter one main keyword and a set of sub keywords into the tool. So for example if you wanted an article about ‘dog collars’ then your main keyword would be ‘dog’ and your sub keyword would be ‘collars’. When it comes to time and the cost of producing articles for your website. The time taken to produce content yourself or the cost of outsourcing content creation really does come into play. Writing content for your website yourself can take lots of time especially if you are needing to produce regular content nearly every day. Also getting someone who is a decent article writer can become very costly. Article Forge can produce most articles in under 2 minutes which is a massive time saver and you could create thousands of articles in the same time it takes for you or someone else to write the content. The tool does cost a whopping $54 a month subscription fee but you have to remember you can produce thousands of articles in that month and the articles created would be much cheaper than outsourcing the content creation to a human writer. Here’s a video review on the Advantages and Disadvantages of Article Forge which may help you decide if this service is for you.

I just happened to come across this question when researching Article Forge. Looks like all the answers are from users who have not tried the product. I signed up for an account today and did a few basic articles with different settings in Article Forge and I can say it does generate decent articles for Search Engine consumption, but they are laughable at best. These tools have a long way to go to create readable content. Not convinced, no problem. Just read this article straight from the tool. I have made zero changes. I used the term Hair Salon. You will see that it would take so much effort to ‘fix’ the article that was created. The result below is the same for multiple keywords that I used. Your hair should last quite a long time so that you don't wish to over damage it because it can acquire brittle and fall out. Healthy hair enhances the attractiveness of a person's face and supplies an enticing look. If you've got dry hair, utilize the egg yolk. I’m not familiar with Article Forge, and working on the assumption that it is an automated content tool I’m tempted to say no. Any form of content placed in the hands of a robot will never reproduce the unique qualities a human can bring to crafting user-friendly copy. Google doesn’t look kindly on content rehashed for the sake of ranking higher or attracting eyeballs - this may even work against you. Tons of these types of sites exist and I’m sure the incentives to use them sound plausible, however, the proof is often in the pudding. Read reviews before you try and find out if the positives outweigh the potential drawbacks mentioned above.

In short, yes Article Forge does generate content good enough for SEO. Article Forge creates unique content that you can use for your tier 1, tier 2 or Money Site. However, sometimes you might have to make minor edits here and there, but it is still way cheaper and efficient to use Article Forge than writing 100% of blog post manually. You can check out Article Forge here: www.articleforge.com

I have used article forge for 1 month and I can clearly say that it is not worth your mony. The article generated were vey vague, off the topic and very repetitive. For $50 you can get good 5–10 articles from any freelance writer rather than signing up for article forge. May be in future if thsy work more on their algorithm, one can think about using it, but its a No for now.

The amount of time it will take you to do the research, eventually spend the money, be semi satisfied with the results, edit to your standards, then start all over again with another similar company just to be sure they don't have a better deal, excetera, excetera… is not worth it. Close quora and go write a blog post. If you actually are in a position where you make too much money for writing blog post to be worth your time, go to upwork and write a proposal for somebody with proven experience in your vertical to write your blog post for you.
Article Forge group buy is a tool that uses highly sophisticated deep understanding algorithms to automatically write articles in the same way as humans.
